solution.text:
Given equation is \(x^2 + _{k}_x + _{j}_\) = 0
Comparing with \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)
We get, a = 1, b = _{k}_ and c = _{j}_
Now, we know :
i.e., Discriminant = \(b^2-4ac\)
i.e., \(b^2-4ac\) = \(_{k}_^2 - 4\times 1\times _{j}_\)
i.e., = _{{k*k}}_ - _{{4*j}}_
i.e., = _{{(k*k)-(4*j)}}_

content.text: Find the discriminant of the quadratic equation \(x^2 + _{k}_x + _{j}_\) = 0.
